Ongoing: Maintain and enhance security posture

  • Annual SOC 2 Type II re-certification audits ($40K-$60K annually)
  • Quarterly penetration testing and continuous vulnerability management ($30K-$50K annually)
  • Ongoing security operations, monitoring, and incident response ($100K-$150K annually for staff + $40K-$80K for tools/MSSP)
Recommended Action: Launch security enhancement program immediately with dedicated InfoSec leader hire or fractional engagement. Position internally as "revenue enablement initiative" rather than "risk mitigation cost"—SOC 2 certification unlocks $2M-$4M in enterprise market opportunities currently inaccessible. Target SOC 2 Type II certification within 12-15 months to enable enterprise client pursuit in next sales cycle.

Opportunity #4: Cloud Migration for Cost Reduction and Operational Agility

Potential Impact: $500K-$900K value over 3 years

The Opportunity: Migrate from legacy on-premise/basic hosted infrastructure to modern cloud-native architecture to reduce operating costs by $120K-$180K annually, avoid $200K-$400K infrastructure refresh capex, improve disaster recovery and business continuity capabilities, enable rapid deployment of new features (weeks vs. months), and provide scalable infrastructure for 20% annual growth without over-provisioning.

Cloud Migration Benefits
  • Cost Optimization: 15-20% reduction in infrastructure operating costs through cloud economies of scale, auto-scaling, and eliminating over-provisioning = $120K-$180K annual savings
  • Avoided Capital Expenditure: Eliminate upcoming server/storage refresh cycle ($200K-$400K capex) by shifting to cloud operational expense model
  • Operational Agility: Reduce new capability deployment from 4-6 weeks to hours/days—accelerate time-to-market for client requests and competitive responses
  • Scalability: Auto-scaling for peak periods (year-end processing, audit season) without over-provisioning year-round—pay only for capacity used
  • Disaster Recovery: Multi-region redundancy and automated failover vs. single-location DR risk—improve from RPO/RTO of 24-48 hours to <1 hour
  • Security & Compliance: Leverage cloud provider security controls (AWS Shield, Azure Security Center) that meet SOC 2/ISO 27001 requirements—reduces security implementation costs
Business Case
Migration Investment $305K-$590K over 24 months (cloud architect, migration services, re-architecture, training)
Annual Infrastructure Savings $120K-$180K (15-20% operating cost reduction)
Avoided Capital Expenditure $200K-$400K (server/storage refresh deferred indefinitely)
Operational Efficiency $40K-$80K annual value from faster deployment and reduced IT maintenance burden
Business Continuity Value Improved DR/BC reduces business interruption risk—value difficult to quantify but material
3-Year Value $560K-$940K (annual savings × 3 years + avoided capex + operational efficiency)
ROI 1.8x-3.1x over 3 years; payback 24-36 months
Migration Strategy

Approach: Phased migration using "lift-and-shift" for non-critical workloads and selective re-architecture for core applications to maximize cloud-native benefits.

Cloud Provider Selection: AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud based on: existing Microsoft relationship (Azure advantage if heavy Office 365 user), team capabilities/training preferences, specific service requirements (AWS has broadest fintech-specific services), and cost modeling for your workload profile. Recommend formal evaluation with 3-month pilot.

Phase 1 (Months 1-6): Foundation and non-critical workloads ($80K-$150K)

  • Cloud architect assessment and migration roadmap ($25K-$40K)
  • Establish cloud landing zone (network, security, governance, identity management)
  • Migrate development/test environments (learning opportunity, low risk)
  • Migrate email, collaboration tools, and other SaaS candidates (quick wins)

Phase 2 (Months 7-18): Core application migration ($150K-$300K)

  • Migrate supporting applications (HR systems, document management, etc.) using lift-and-shift
  • Plan core plan administration platform migration—assess build vs. buy vs. re-architect decisions
  • Execute core platform migration with appropriate re-architecture for cloud optimization
  • Implement cloud-native backup, DR, and monitoring

Phase 3 (Months 19-24): Optimization and decommissioning ($75K-$140K)

  • Optimize cloud resource allocation and costs (reserved instances, auto-scaling policies)
  • Decommission on-premise infrastructure and realize cost savings
  • Implement FinOps practices for ongoing cloud cost management
  • Train IT team on cloud operations and architecture
Risk Mitigation
  • Migration Risk: Use phased approach starting with non-critical workloads to build confidence and capabilities before migrating core systems
  • Cost Overruns: Conduct detailed cost modeling and implement FinOps governance from day one to prevent cloud cost surprises (common issue)
  • Skills Gap: Invest in cloud training/certifications for IT team (AWS Certified Solutions Architect, Azure Administrator) concurrent with migration—$15K-$30K for team training
  • Vendor Lock-In: Use cloud-agnostic architectures where practical (containers, Kubernetes) to maintain flexibility
Recommended Action: Initiate cloud migration planning within 6 months after stabilizing higher-priority initiatives (automation, CX, security). While cloud migration delivers meaningful long-term value, it's lower urgency than customer-facing improvements and security. However, begin planning now because migration takes 18-24 months and timing should align with upcoming infrastructure refresh cycle to maximize capital avoidance benefit.

🎯 Strategic Recommendations & Action Plan

Based on comprehensive technology assessment, EWM Global should execute a coordinated technology transformation program over 24-30 months that modernizes infrastructure, enhances customer experience, strengthens security, and positions the company for sustainable growth to $30M+ revenue. This program requires $2.5M-$3.8M total investment delivering $4M-$7M in value through revenue growth, cost reduction, and risk mitigation—ROI of 2.7x-4.2x over 3 years.

Technology Transformation Framework: Three Parallel Tracks

Execute technology transformation across three parallel tracks with different timelines and objectives:

Track 1: Immediate Priorities (Months 1-12)

Foundation-building initiatives that address critical gaps, enable growth, and deliver quick ROI

  • Process Automation: Deploy RPA and workflow automation for manual-intensive operations—target $400K-$600K annual savings
  • CX Quick Wins: Implement CRM/support platform and feedback collection—improve response times to <8 hours within 6 months
  • Security Enhancement Launch: Hire InfoSec leader, implement 24/7 monitoring, initiate SOC 2 readiness assessment
  • Technology Roadmap: Develop 3-5 year strategic technology plan with executive team alignment
Investment: $600K-$1M Year 1
Expected Return: $700K-$1.2M annual value (primarily cost savings and efficiency)
Track 2: Core Transformation (Months 6-24)

Fundamental technology modernization that drives competitive differentiation and revenue growth

  • Customer Experience Modernization: Complete client portal redesign, self-service enhancement, mobile optimization—drive NPS from 4 to 30+
  • Data & Analytics Platform: Implement BI capabilities, data warehouse, advanced analytics—enable premium service differentiation
  • SOC 2 Certification: Achieve Type II certification to unlock enterprise market segment
  • Cloud Migration: Transition infrastructure to cloud for cost optimization and operational agility
Investment: $1.2M-$1.8M over 18 months
Expected Return: $1.5M-$2.8M annual value (revenue growth + retention + cost savings)
Track 3: Innovation & Growth (Months 12-36)

Strategic initiatives that position EWM Global for long-term competitive advantage and market expansion

  • Advanced Analytics Services: Package analytics as value-added offering—benchmarking, predictive insights, advisory services
  • Adjacent Product Expansion: Modernize and expand share plan administration (currently 1% of revenue) leveraging existing infrastructure
  • API Platform: Develop partner APIs for seamless client system integration and fintech ecosystem participation
  • Emerging Technology Pilots: AI/ML for data validation, blockchain exploration for audit trail, embedded finance capabilities
Investment: $700K-$1M over 24 months
Expected Return: $800K-$2M annual revenue from new services and market expansion (2-3 year horizon)

Top 5 Technology Recommendations (Prioritized by Impact × Urgency)

PRIORITY #1
Launch Comprehensive Process Automation Program
Timeline: Initiate Month 1, 18-month execution

What: Deploy RPA, workflow automation, BI platform, and CRM/ticketing system to eliminate 35-45% of manual process burden, improve quality by 80%, enable scaling to $30M+ revenue with minimal headcount growth.

Why Priority #1: Automation delivers highest ROI (4.3x-6.3x over 3 years), fastest payback (6-10 months), and removes hard scaling constraint at $28-$30M revenue. Without automation, you cannot achieve 20% growth target without unsustainable hiring (16-18 operational staff @ $1.1M-$1.3M). Automation also improves quality, reduces response times, and frees capacity for strategic initiatives.

Specific Actions:

  • Month 1: Engage automation consultant or fractional automation lead to assess processes and develop implementation roadmap ($15K-$25K)
  • Months 1-2: Select and implement CRM/ticketing platform (Salesforce, Zendesk, HubSpot)—quick win for response time improvement ($30K-$60K)
  • Months 2-4: Select RPA platform (UiPath, Automation Anywhere, Blue Prism) and deploy first 3-5 bots for highest-volume data entry workflows ($80K-$120K)
  • Months 3-6: Implement BI platform (Tableau, Power BI, Looker) and automate 10-15 standard reports ($60K-$100K)
  • Months 7-12: Expand RPA to reconciliation, compliance monitoring, additional data workflows ($60K-$120K)
  • Months 13-18: Deploy AI/ML-based validation, advanced automation, process mining for continuous improvement ($100K-$160K)

Success Metrics:

  • Reduce manual process burden from 35-45% to <15-20% of employee capacity (20-25 percentage point improvement)
  • Achieve $400K-$600K annual labor cost savings in first year, scaling to $800K-$1.2M by end of Year 2
  • Improve data accuracy by 80% (measured by error rates and remediation time)
  • Enable growth to $30M revenue with 3-8 net new hires vs. 16-18 without automation
  • Reduce standard report generation time from 4-8 hours to <30 minutes

Investment: $400K-$700K over 18 months

Expected ROI: 4.3x-6.3x over 3 years; payback in 6-10 months

Executive Action Required: CEO/COO to sponsor automation program as strategic growth enabler. Assign dedicated project manager (internal or external) with 50%+ time allocation. Establish automation steering committee with operations, IT, and finance representation for prioritization and change management. Communicate to staff that automation frees them for higher-value work, not elimination—redeploy capacity to client service and strategic initiatives.
PRIORITY #2
Transform Customer Experience Through Technology Modernization
Timeline: Initiate Month 1-2, 18-month execution

What: Redesign client portal and participant interfaces with modern UX, comprehensive self-service, real-time dashboards, mobile optimization, proactive communication, and systematic feedback collection. Implement support platform to reduce response times from 24 hours to <4 hours. Drive NPS from 4 to 30-40+ over 12-18 months.

Why Priority #2: CX modernization directly addresses your weakest business metric (Customer Experience: 49/100, NPS: 4) and delivers measurable revenue impact through improved retention (40-60% churn reduction), competitive win rate improvement (15-25%), and referral generation (3-5x increase). Low NPS of 4 creates existential risk—customers with NPS <20 exhibit 2.5x higher churn likelihood. Technology is root cause of CX issues (dated interfaces, limited self-service, slow response times), making this technology initiative with direct business outcome accountability.

Specific Actions:

  • Months 1-2: Implement CRM/support platform (overlaps with automation Priority #1) for inquiry management, SLA tracking, knowledge base ($30K-$60K)
  • Months 1-2: Deploy automated NPS/CSAT feedback collection ($10K-$20K)—begin systematic voice-of-customer program
  • Months 2-4: Conduct UX research (client interviews, usability testing, competitive analysis) and design new portal experience ($40K-$80K)
  • Months 4-6: Implement quick portal improvements—navigation, mobile responsiveness, visual refresh ($20K-$40K for quick wins)
  • Months 6-12: Develop and deploy fully redesigned client portal with self-service reporting, real-time dashboards, transaction initiation ($150K-$250K)
  • Months 10-15: Implement proactive alert/notification system and enhance mobile experience ($60K-$100K)
  • Months 13-18: Deploy AI-powered chatbot for common inquiries and optimize self-service adoption ($40K-$80K)

Success Metrics:

  • Improve NPS from 4 to 30+ within 18 months (26-point improvement)
  • Reduce average response time from 24 hours to <4 hours within 6 months
  • Achieve 40-60% client adoption of self-service reporting within 12 months
  • Reduce support inquiry volume by 35-50% through self-service and proactive communication
  • Improve customer satisfaction from 4/5 to 4.5+/5
  • Reduce annual customer churn by 40-60% (measured 12-18 months post-implementation)

Investment: $350K-$650K over 18 months

Expected ROI: 4.2x-8.3x over 3 years through retention, new revenue, and efficiency gains

Executive Action Required: CEO to position CX modernization as strategic growth initiative tied to NPS and retention goals. Form cross-functional CX steering committee (sales, client service, product, IT) to ensure technology decisions align with client needs. Conduct quarterly NPS measurement and closed-loop feedback to track progress and adjust approach. Consider external CX consultant for UX research and design phase to ensure client-centered approach ($40K-$80K well spent).
PRIORITY #3
Implement Comprehensive Cybersecurity Program and Achieve SOC 2 Certification
Timeline: Initiate immediately, 12-15 month execution for SOC 2

What: Hire dedicated InfoSec leader, implement 24/7 security monitoring, conduct penetration testing quarterly, achieve SOC 2 Type II certification, complete security awareness training for all employees, and develop/test incident response capabilities. Transform security from basic controls (52/100) to mature fintech security program.

Why Priority #3: Cybersecurity is both existential risk (single material breach = $3M-$10M cost) and revenue enabler (SOC 2 unlocks 10-20% of addressable market requiring security certifications). Your current security gaps create client contract vulnerability—institutional financial services clients increasingly require SOC 2 Type II as prerequisite for vendor selection. Without certification, you're eliminated from $2M-$4M+ in enterprise opportunities. Additionally, regulatory environment for fintech intensifying—inadequate security could trigger compliance violations (see Compliance section: 77/100 with monitoring gaps).

Specific Actions:

  • Month 1: Hire InfoSec Director ($100K-$140K) or engage fractional CISO ($60K-$100K annually)—critical leadership gap
  • Months 1-2: Conduct comprehensive security assessment and SOC 2 readiness gap analysis ($20K-$35K)
  • Months 1-3: Implement 24/7 security monitoring via SIEM or managed SOC service ($40K-$80K annually)
  • Months 2-3: Complete security awareness training for all 85 employees to close 20% gap ($10K-$15K)
  • Months 3-6: Implement recommended controls from security assessment—endpoint protection, email security, access management enhancements, data encryption, vulnerability management ($80K-$150K)
  • Month 6: Conduct penetration testing and remediate findings ($25K-$40K)—establish quarterly testing cadence
  • Months 6-9: Develop incident response plan, conduct tabletop exercises, establish security operations procedures ($15K-$25K)
  • Months 6-9: Begin SOC 2 Type I audit with 3-month observation period ($30K-$50K)
  • Months 9-18: Complete SOC 2 Type II audit with 9-month observation period ($30K-$50K additional)
  • Month 15-18: Receive SOC 2 Type II report—market to enterprise clients

Success Metrics:

  • Achieve SOC 2 Type II certification within 15 months
  • Implement 24/7 security monitoring with <48 hour breach detection (vs. industry avg 212 days)
  • Complete 100% security awareness training with quarterly phishing simulations achieving <5% click rate
  • Pass quarterly penetration tests with zero critical or high-severity findings
  • Unlock $2M-$4M in enterprise opportunities requiring SOC 2; capture $400K-$1.2M revenue within 18 months post-certification
  • Reduce cyber insurance premiums by 20-30% ($20K-$40K annual savings)

Investment: $300K-$485K first year; $240K-$385K ongoing annually

Expected ROI: 2.6x-3.9x over 3 years on revenue benefits alone; risk mitigation provides additional unquantified value

Executive Action Required: CEO and Board to treat cybersecurity as strategic priority, not IT issue. Present security investment as revenue enablement (SOC 2 unlocks enterprise segment) rather than pure cost. Establish security steering committee with executive representation for quarterly review. Engage Board in annual security briefing and tabletop exercise. Budget $300K-$485K first year, $240K-$385K ongoing—position as protecting $24M revenue base and enabling growth into enterprise market.
PRIORITY #4
Develop Comprehensive Technology Roadmap and Enhance IT Leadership
Timeline: Months 1-3 for roadmap; ongoing for leadership

What: Engage fractional CTO or senior technology consultant to facilitate 3-5 year technology roadmap aligned to business strategy. Deliverable should include architectural vision, capability maturity targets, multi-year investment priorities, organizational structure requirements, and annual budgets. Concurrently, enhance IT leadership capabilities through strategic hires (cloud architect, InfoSec director) and upskilling existing team.

Why Priority #4: Technology decisions currently made tactically without strategic framework—this explains suboptimal investment allocation (85-90% operations vs. 10-15% innovation) and accumulated technical debt. Strategic roadmap provides decision-making framework for $2.5M-$3.8M technology investment over next 24-30 months and ensures alignment with 20% growth objective. Without roadmap, you risk misallocated investments and disconnected initiatives that don't deliver business outcomes.

Specific Actions:

  • Month 1: Engage fractional CTO or senior technology strategist for 3-month roadmap development ($25K-$50K)
  • Months 1-2: Current state assessment—document existing systems, processes, capabilities, and pain points through stakeholder interviews and technical review
  • Month 2: Future state vision workshop with executive team—align technology capabilities to business strategy and 3-5 year growth objectives
  • Month 3: Develop comprehensive technology roadmap including: architectural principles, capability maturity model, multi-year initiative priorities, organizational requirements, investment budgets, success metrics, governance model
  • Months 3-6: Recruit strategic technology leadership—InfoSec Director (Priority #3), cloud architect or senior engineer with modern skills ($120K-$180K)
  • Ongoing: Establish quarterly technology steering committee with CEO, CFO, COO, CTO/IT Director for roadmap review and investment decisions
  • Year 1: Invest in IT team upskilling—cloud certifications (AWS/Azure), security training, modern development practices ($30K-$50K annually)

Success Metrics:

  • Complete 3-5 year technology roadmap with executive alignment by Month 3
  • Rebalance technology investment from 85-90% operations to 60-70% operations / 30-40% innovation by Year 2
  • Hire 2-3 strategic technology roles (InfoSec, cloud architect, senior engineer) by Month 9
  • Achieve 80%+ IT team participation in upskilling programs (certifications, training) within 12 months
  • Establish quarterly technology governance process with documented decisions and ROI tracking
  • Improve technology capability maturity from average 45-50/100 to 65-75/100 over 24 months

Investment: $200K-$300K (roadmap $25K-$50K + strategic hires $150K-$200K + training $30K-$50K)

Expected ROI: Indirect—enables effective execution of Priorities #1-3 and prevents $300K-$500K in misallocated investments

Executive Action Required: CEO to personally sponsor roadmap development with 10-15 hours time commitment for workshops and review. CFO to participate actively to ensure financial framework and ROI discipline. Position roadmap as strategic planning exercise, not IT document—technology roadmap should flow from and support business strategy. Use completed roadmap as basis for annual technology budget and quarterly investment decisions.
PRIORITY #5
Execute Cloud Migration for Infrastructure Modernization
Timeline: Begin planning Month 6, execute Months 9-30

What: Migrate from legacy on-premise/basic hosted infrastructure to modern cloud-native architecture (AWS, Azure, or GCP) over 18-24 months using phased approach. Start with non-critical workloads and development environments, then migrate core plan administration applications with selective re-architecture for cloud optimization.

Why Priority #5: Cloud migration delivers meaningful long-term value ($120K-$180K annual operating savings + $200K-$400K avoided capex) and operational benefits (scalability, disaster recovery, deployment agility), but lower urgency than customer-facing improvements, security, and automation. However, timing is strategic—upcoming infrastructure refresh cycle (likely within 18-24 months based on 10-15 year old systems) presents ideal migration window. Deferring cloud migration means investing $200K-$400K in on-premise refresh that perpetuates inefficient model, whereas cloud migration avoids this capex while delivering superior capabilities.

Specific Actions:

  • Months 6-9: Cloud readiness assessment and migration roadmap with cloud architect ($25K-$40K)—align with overall technology roadmap from Priority #4
  • Months 9-12: Establish cloud foundation—select provider (AWS/Azure/GCP), set up landing zone, migrate dev/test environments ($80K-$120K)
  • Months 12-18: Migrate supporting applications using lift-and-shift approach—collaboration tools, document management, HR systems ($60K-$100K)
  • Months 15-24: Plan and execute core plan administration platform migration—assess re-architecture opportunities for cloud-native benefits ($150K-$300K depending on complexity)
  • Months 24-30: Optimize cloud resource allocation, decommission on-premise infrastructure, realize cost savings ($50K-$80K for optimization and cleanup)
  • Ongoing: Implement FinOps practices for cloud cost management, continuous optimization ($20K-$40K annually for tools and governance)

Success Metrics:

  • Complete migration of 80%+ workloads to cloud by Month 24-30
  • Achieve 15-20% infrastructure operating cost reduction ($120K-$180K annual savings) by 12 months post-migration
  • Avoid $200K-$400K on-premise infrastructure refresh capex
  • Improve disaster recovery RPO/RTO from 24-48 hours to <1 hour through multi-region redundancy
  • Reduce new capability deployment time from 4-6 weeks to <1 week
  • Achieve 75%+ IT team cloud proficiency (certifications, hands-on experience) by migration completion

Investment: $305K-$590K over 24 months

Expected ROI: 1.8x-3.1x over 3 years; payback 24-36 months

Executive Action Required: CFO to model total cost of ownership (TCO) comparing cloud migration vs. on-premise refresh over 5-year horizon—this provides financial justification. CEO/COO to approve phased migration approach that maintains operational stability during transition. IT Director to lead migration with external cloud architect support and dedicate 1-2 senior engineers 50%+ time to migration project. Begin planning now (Month 6) to align with infrastructure refresh timeline and avoid locked-in on-premise investment.

📅 24-Month Implementation Roadmap

Execute technology transformation through coordinated program with clear milestones, dependencies, and success metrics. This roadmap sequences initiatives for maximum business impact while managing risk and resource constraints.

Q1 (Months 1-3): Foundation & Quick Wins

Technology Strategy
  • Engage fractional CTO for roadmap development
  • Complete current state assessment
  • Conduct future state vision workshop with executives
  • Deliver comprehensive 3-5 year technology roadmap
Security Foundation
  • Hire InfoSec Director or engage fractional CISO
  • Conduct security assessment and SOC 2 readiness analysis
  • Implement 24/7 security monitoring (SIEM/MSSP)
  • Complete security awareness training for all 85 employees
Automation Quick Wins
  • Engage automation consultant for process assessment
  • Implement CRM/ticketing platform
  • Select RPA platform and deploy first 2-3 bots
  • Begin response time improvement (target <12 hours by end Q1)
CX Foundation
  • Deploy automated NPS/feedback collection
  • Initiate UX research (client interviews, usability testing)
  • Baseline current CX metrics (NPS: 4, CES: 4/5, response times: 24hrs)
Q1 Investment: $200K-$350K
Expected Outcomes: Strategic foundation established, security monitoring live, 10-15% improvement in response times, first RPA bots deployed

Q2 (Months 4-6): Core Implementation Begins

Automation Expansion
  • Deploy 3-5 additional RPA bots for data entry workflows
  • Implement BI platform (Tableau, Power BI, Looker)
  • Automate 10-15 standard reports
  • Target: $100K-$150K annualized labor savings achieved
Security Enhancement
  • Implement security controls from gap assessment
  • Conduct first penetration test and remediate findings
  • Develop incident response plan and conduct tabletop exercise
  • Begin SOC 2 Type I audit (3-month observation period starts)
CX Design & Quick Improvements
  • Complete UX research and design new portal experience
  • Implement quick portal improvements (navigation, mobile, visual refresh)
  • Target: Response times <8 hours, first NPS improvement visible
Cloud Planning
  • Initiate cloud readiness assessment
  • Cloud provider evaluation (AWS vs. Azure vs. GCP)
Q2 Investment: $250K-$400K
Expected Outcomes: Automation delivering measurable savings, SOC 2 Type I in progress, response times <8hrs, portal redesign ready for development

Q3 (Months 7-9): Transformation Acceleration

CX Transformation
  • Begin development of redesigned client portal
  • Implement real-time dashboards and self-service reporting
  • Launch knowledge base for client self-service
  • Target: Response times <4 hours, 20-30% self-service adoption
Automation Phase 2
  • Deploy reconciliation automation
  • Implement client onboarding workflow automation
  • Begin compliance monitoring automation
  • Target: $200K-$300K annualized savings achieved
Security Milestones
  • Complete SOC 2 Type I audit
  • Begin SOC 2 Type II observation period (9 months)
  • Second penetration test cycle
Cloud Migration Starts
  • Complete cloud migration roadmap
  • Establish cloud landing zone and foundational infrastructure
  • Begin migration of dev/test environments
Q3 Investment: $200K-$350K
Expected Outcomes: New portal in development, automation savings scaling, SOC 2 Type II in progress, cloud foundation established

  • Complete and launch redesigned client portal
  • Deploy proactive alert/notification system
  • Mobile experience enhancements
  • Target: NPS improving toward 20-25, CES 4.3+/5

  • Begin data warehouse design for unified analytics

  • Supporting applications migration underway
  • Plan core platform migration approach
Q4 Investment: $250K-$400K
Year 1 Total: $900K-$1.5M

Key Milestone: New client portal live, SOC 2 Type II 6 months from completion, automation delivering material savings
